snippet: Apple has failed to prevent its competitor Samsung from selling a touchscreen tablet in Australia. An Australian court lifted a temporary sales ban on Samsung’s tablet, in time for the holiday shopping season.

headline.main: Samsung Wins a Round in Patent Fight With Apple

snippet: Technology companies have the lowest percentages of women board members and highest-paid executives among the biggest public companies in California, according to a new study.
abstract: Technology companies have the lowest percentages of women board members and highest-paid executives among the biggest public companies in California, according to a new study.

headline.main: Where Are the Women Executives in Silicon Valley?

snippet: Technology companies have the lowest percentages of women board members and highest-paid executives among the biggest public companies in California, according to a new study. Some, like Advent Software and Hewlett-Packard, break the mold, while o...
abstract: Technology companies have the lowest percentages of women board members and highest-paid executives among the biggest public companies in California, according to a new study. Some, like Advent Software and Hewlett-Packard, break the mold, while others, like Apple and Adobe, have very little gender diversity in the upper ranks.

headline.main: Where Are the Women Executives in Silicon Valley?

abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web each day for interesting items. Today’s selection includes anger over an Amazon offer aimed at shoppers in brick-and-mortar stores, and a decision by the Black Keys to stay off of streaming services.

headline.main: Today’s Scuttlebot: Black Keys and Price Checks

snippet: “Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy,” with Gary Oldman as George Smiley, skillfully mined from John le Carré’s book, is a mystery about spies spying on spies.
